feedback.Physical Object: Included — A discrete, bounded specimen with solid form.
feedback.Synthetic: Excluded — Naturally formed without human intervention.
feedback.Biological/Biomimetic: Included — Produced by biological organisms (coral polyps).
feedback.Powered: Excluded — No dependence on energy supply.
feedback.Structural: Included — Rigid, load-bearing structure contributing to reef formations.
feedback.Observable: Included — Visibly identifiable and perceptible to touch and sight.
feedback.Physical Medium: Included — Composed of solid matter (calcium carbonate).
feedback.Active: Excluded — It has no autonomous internal behavior or dynamic response.
feedback.Outputs Effect: Excluded — Does not emit energy, signal, or force.
feedback.Processes Signals/Logic: Excluded — No informational or logical operations.
feedback.State-Transforming: Excluded — Inert; no internal or functional change occurs.
feedback.Human-Interactive: Excluded — Not intrinsically designed for user interaction.
feedback.System-integrated: Excluded — A detached fragment, no longer part of a living reef system.
feedback.Functionally Autonomous: Excluded — Lacks autonomous behavior or internal control.
feedback.System-Essential: Excluded — Not a critical component of any active system.
feedback.Symbolic: Excluded — Not inherently a symbol, even if symbolically interpreted in culture.
feedback.Signalling: Excluded — Does not convey structured information or meaning on its own.
feedback.Rule-governed: Excluded — No abstract rules define its structure or use.
feedback.Compositional: Excluded — Not organized from modular subcomponents with distinct function.
feedback.Normative: Excluded — Does not guide behavior or enforce norms.
feedback.Temporal: Excluded — Has no time-based function or dependency.
feedback.Digital/Virtual: Excluded — Entirely physical and real-world in substance.
feedback.Social Construct: Excluded — Exists independently of social categorization.
feedback.Institutionally Defined: Excluded — Not defined by law, classification, or official status.
feedback.Identity-Linked: Excluded — Not tied to personal, group, or role identity.
feedback.Regulated: Excluded — While coral trade may be regulated, the fragment itself is not intrinsically governed.
feedback.Economically Significant: Included — Has material value in trade, tourism, and ornamentation.
feedback.Politicised: Included — Involved in conservation policy, climate discourse, and marine territorial debates.
feedback.Ritualised: Excluded — May be used ceremonially, but this is a secondary cultural attribution.
feedback.Ethically Significant: Included — Its status as a harvested fragment implies ecological and conservation-related ethical concerns.

encoding_notes: Encoding reflects a coral reef fragment as a biological, material object with no symbolic or systemic function. Ethical and political significance are intrinsic to its detached status in the context of reef exploitation and global ecological awareness.
